member.summary: Current contact ID.

member.name: M:CMS.ContactManagement.ContactManagementContext.GetCurrentContact(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns current contact. Tries to find contact in persistent storage, obtains it from the users or tries to recognize it according to known information. If no contact can be found and is true (default), it creates a new anonymous contact. If Online marketing is not enabled or there is no license for ContactManagement found, null is returned. Also, null is returned if request is made by crawler (googlebot, etc.). Currently authenticated user is used to find contacts.
member.param: Indicates whether anonymous contact should be created if no contact information can be found.
member.returns: Current contact

member.name: M:CMS.ContactManagement.ContactManagementContext.UpdateUserLoginContact(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the contact assigned to the specified user. The contact is retrieved from persistent storage and is compared with all the contacts related to the given user. Applies contact merging to resolve the conflicts when the selected contact is already in relationship with another user.
member.remarks: Use only for login and registration purposes. The method has no effect and returns null if the ContactManagement feature is disabled or unavailable in the license.
member.param: Username of user the contact must be assigned to.

member.name: M:CMS.ContactManagement.ContactInfoObjectQueryExtensions.NotBounced``1(``0,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Filters out contacts whose email address is unreachable (it has bounced more than times). Subscribers blocked manually by administrator are filtered out as well. The column which stores number of bounces has to be specified in parameter, because each object which stores bounces count has differently named column.
member.param: Condition which will be changed to include where clause filtering out bounced subscribers
Name of the column which stores number of times the email of the subscriber bounced (e.g. SubscriberBounces, ContactBounces)
If true, bounces will be checked against the parameter. Otherwise, only subscribers blocked via UI will be filtered out (as if was 0).
Limit of bounces which are allowed. If 0, only subscribers blocked via UI will be filtered out.
member.returns: IWhereCondition with additional filter

member.name: M:CMS.ContactManagement.IMacroRuleTreeToDataQueryTranslator.TranslateWithTransformation(CMS.MacroEngine.MacroRuleTree,System.Func{CMS.DataEngine.ObjectQuery{CMS.ContactManagement.ContactInfo},CMS.DataEngine.ObjectQuery{CMS.ContactManagement.ContactInfo}})
member.summary: Translates macro rule tree into a data query. Macro rule instances are translated into individual data queries and combined together using UNION and INTERSECT statements into single data query. A transformation function specified in is applied to every individual data query converted from a macro rule instance. Produced data queries will return objects matching the condition of the macro rule tree. Throws exception if any of the macro rules cannot be translated.
member.param: Root element of the macro rule tree
Transformation function which will be applied to every data query part. Use this function to further restrict results by applying Where, to specify column which should be returned, etc.
member.returns: DataQuery representing macro rule tree

member.name: T:CMS.ContactManagement.MacroRuleMetadataContainer
member.summary: Class for registering to the system. Use or to speed up recalculation of contact groups when registered macro rule is used in group condition.
member.remarks:
Registering can have two profound effects on speed of recalculation.
First is recalculating contacts in the database - normally, when a contact group is being rebuilt, system takes all contacts from database and runs the macro condition on each of those. By registering a translator to a rule, the computation can be inverted, that means at first, a database query will be constructed to select only those contacts that fit given macro condition.
All of the macro rules must be able to translate themselves to database query to use this functionality.
Second is recalculating the rule only when specified type of activity performs, for example when a performs, there is no need to recalculate macro rules. This can significantly reduce the count of contact groups that need rebuild on each request.

member.summary: Checks which contacts were affected by attribute rule. In other words, provides information which contacts should be recalculated for a certain rule.
member.remarks:
Contact is affected by attribute rule if one of this conditions is met: - contact was just created (see is true) - rule is based on contact's property which was changed ( is present in )
Performing activities don't affect attribute rules.

member.name: T:CMS.ContactManagement.ContactsAffectedByMacroRulesMatcher
member.summary: Checks which contacts were affected by macro rule. In other words, provides information which contacts should be recalculated for a certain rule.
member.remarks: Contact is affected by macro rule if one of this conditions is met: - contact's property has changed (contact is present in the list of contact changes represented by ). - contact has performed activity which is affected by the rule's macro. Activities affected by various macro rules are defined in .

member.summary: Executes asynchronous recalculation of score.

member.remarks: Note that the method does not check if the score is already being recalculated. That is, multiple recalculations for the same score may be running at one time. As a base date for the cookie expiration is used current date time, therefore when TimeSpan.FromDays(20) is used for at midnight on 2016/01/01, the cookie will expire at midnight on 2016/01/21.

member.name: M:CMS.ContactManagement.CurrentContactProviderContextDecorator.GetCurrentContact(CMS.Base.IUserInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks whether processing of contact can continue. If so, recognizes a contact currently browsing the live site. If the contact cannot be recognized a new one is created. A returned contact is always valid (exists in database, is not merged, etc.) and is automatically assigned to User (if it's not a public user).
member.param: Currently signed in user or public user
If true, the current contact is tried to be determined by the user even if it can be found by other ways
member.exception: Processing of contacts cannot continue. This can be due to the insufficient license, disabled online marketing or incorrect request state.
member.returns: The recognized contact or a new contact, if it was not possible to recognize the contact.

member.name: M:CMS.ContactManagement.CurrentContactProviderContextDecorator.GetExistingContact(CMS.Base.IUserInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks whether processing of contact can continue. If so, gets a contact assigned to the visitor currently browsing the live site (contact can only be recognized during web request). A returned contact is always valid (exists in database, is not merged, etc.) and is automatically assigned to (if it's not a public user). If no contact is currently assigned to the visitor null is returned.
member.param: Currently signed in user or public user
If true, the current contact is tried to be determined by the user even if it can be found by other ways
member.exception: Processing of contacts cannot continue. This can be due to the insufficient license, disabled online marketing or incorrect request state.
member.returns: The recognized contact or null when there is no contact assigned to current live site visitor
